AFAIK when customers pre-ordered their 60s Devon Caravette they were asked what colour curtains and cushions they would like, choosing them from swatches. But Devon also made complete campers that went into VW dealerships to be sold - those are the vans that had 'standard' curtain colours matched with the paint colour, so green curtains etc with Velvet Green paintwork, red with red/white vans and blue with Sea Blue/white vans.
Similar matches were made to the bay vans - Sierra Yellow/Pastel White bays almost always had yellow striped curtains.
I know this from conversations with ex-employees. I have seen very OG Devons with all sorts of curtain colours. Our Sea Blue/Blue White 1967 Spaceway was taken back to Sidmouth in 1972 to have new red curtains (bay striped) fitted because the owner didn't like the OG blue checked curtains.

BTW - the set the Saint has are completely original and in awesome condition, possibly because they were ordered as a spare set, apparently it was common for people to buy a spare set with the van. We have a spare set in our 72 bay - and no, I'm not selling them! The sliders in the pic were indeed for the Devon curtains and, as Maddy says, go into Silentgliss rail, but the curtain hooks were chromed metal not plastic. They are NLA but I might know where there is a stash of NOS Be warned though - they go rusty after a few years.
